Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: ALim082
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2-days stay at this hotel. There is a notice posted: The use of shuttle buses will be charged E4 one way to the city centre, return is free. E2 to the EUR Magliana and Euroma2. Taking effect on the 6th April 2012. THERE IS NO MORE FREE SHUTTLE. Staff at reception speaks good English. House keeping/ room services very poor. Asked for firm/ hard pillows, but they did not understand. No slippers were provided, called up but the reply was "we have completely run out of slippers". Rooms are clean, but dated.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff..”
Reviews.Author: VictorBon
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a couple of days at this hotel. I loved it. The rooms are big and comfortable, lovely bath and spotlessly clean. The bed is not a heavenly bed as one finds at Westins and the pillows were not to my liking. The breakfast too is not exorbitant but good enough. The staff were wonderful, helpful and friendly..

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed A
Reviews.Content: I really liked it. Was nice quite place to stay in, rooms were clean with nice bathrooms and comfy beds. The receptionists were very friendly and so nice and english spoken which made my stay easy and smooth. However, there were not much of choices in the breakfast buffet but was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice if you prefer to stay outside city with access to city~”
Reviews.Author: mslyn08
Reviews.Content: Spent last night here before returning to US. Staff was very nice and helpful. Loved that we got to use the FREE shuttle to and from the City. Was very good choice to end the trip.

Reviews.Title: “I really like this hotel. Think twice about some of the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: American_in_London
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot. Its mid-March 2012 and its my third two week stay in Rome this year. I am very happy with the Sheraton Golf Parco de'Medici. In fact, a hotel "not to be named" is directly across from the offices where I work every day, and I would walk a mile to stay at the Sheraton instead (in fact, the office is a mile (1.6 km) away and I did walk that for a while, but now the Sheraton shuttle takes me from building 2 to building 1 (at the golf course) every morning, so I only walk half a mile. A not unpleasant walk, well worth it. But guess what. It is the restaurant that blows me away. Chef Dario Colaricchiovi (spelling?) is a master. I have written to the RSVP column at Bon Appetit magazine to ask them to request his recipe for the Tagliata (even though I also had the vermicelli with bacon, seafood and asparagus six nights in a row - amazing, this guy). The service has been fine. The room clean, and while the internet is not the cheapest, it has been completely reliable and with enough bandwidth for crystal clear video calls on Skype. If you don't need to stay downtown, give this place consideration. You might be surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Room, Comfy Bed, Crazy Far from the City”
Reviews.Author: Mason K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton as part of our Honeymoon trip last September. The service at the hotel was very warm and welcoming. Check in was quick and efficient. Our room was comfortable and clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable to sleep in that we had during our trip. The one knock against the Sheraton is that it is difficult to get to from the Rome city center. We were not flying in or out, merely taking trains, so the location was not convenient at all. The shuttle to the hotel supposedly runs a few times per day, but after exploring the web site and communicating with the front desk, we were not able to figure out where exactly the pick up was. (They used landmarks for directions rather than subway stops and streets.) Instead, we took a 30Euro cab ride from the city center to the hotel. I would recommend the hotel for someone that is flying into the airport or flying out the next day, but not for anyone who has a serious agenda in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Rome has better to offer for a visitor!”
Reviews.Author: SpicyCinderella
Reviews.Content: Originally booked for 3 nights in late January 2012, I finally only spent 2 nights in that 3-building hotel located in Parco de Medici : an industrial area at 12 min away from the airport and close to several foreign companies HQs. I stayed in Sheraton 2 and had a business meeting in Sheraton 3 and cannot report anything else than both hotels looks upclass Sheraton standards but with no soul or spirit. The staff is courteous and polite but not very caring or showing concerned by the customers. The rooms are big by Rome standards but have nothing special, they are plain. They are made of paper walls and I got woken up at 2.00 am by the room clients above my room on the 1st night.The bathroom has nothing fancy and is not equipped with a shower cabin, but with a bathtube and a curtain enabling a shower if needed. The breakfast buffet was not ok, but was not offering the variety one could expect from such a hotel. Expresso and cappucino can be provided, if you make the request in Italian to the staff, otherwise only filter coffee is on display.The bar is nice but quite expensvie compared to ordinary bars in Town. I can't comment on the golf since there was snow in the region and it was just a whitish huge field outside. I cannot say it was a bad hotel, it is just that I did not feel like living a great moment while there. In fact, the place was too far to go anywhere by walking alone, Rome city center could be reached by a shuttle. Internet rates are outrageous: 18 to 21 Euros for 24 hours wifi. I believe that for new travellers it is worth looking for another hotel alternative closer to city center. Staff from Hotel Sheraton Roma were very nice and caring compared with Sheraton Golf ones.

Reviews.Title: “good and bad equals average.”
Reviews.Author: eamonncourtney
Reviews.Content: we were trapped in rome due to an wild cat strike at the airport, and it took 2 days to find a flight back, so we needed a hotel out of the city and on the way to the airport, as platinium members with starwood we were upgraded to a bigger room, we had a lovely meal in our room on the first night, however on the second night the meal to our room was dire, i rang down and was told they were busy and call back later,,,this was a red rag to a bull with me, i took the food down to reception to complain and was when i tried to talk to the staff i was ingored and told to step away. ENOUGH...i promply dropped the plate of food on the reception countertop...i was suprised that the plate did not break but the noise throughtout the reception was huge,,,every one of the staff stopped chatting to each other,,,at last i had some one's attention...at once a manager zoomed in on me, i was fit to burst at the way we were treated,,,,saying that, the manager was very receptive to my complaint and dealt with it without any fuss, personally delivering a new meal with complementary champange and food free of charge, which was the correct thing to do and thus restored the status quo

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for conferencing or airport stay”
Reviews.Author: happyatif
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this for a conference. As others say its not near the city (25-30 minutes in a taxi) at all but convenient for the airport about 10-15 minutes away by taxi. The hotel itself is very comfortable, with very nice rooms and for me the best part was the outdoor swimming pool area, it was very relaxing and well maintained. As a muslim, i asked for the direction to Mecca for prayers and the staff were very helpful it working it out for me. Breakfast was usual continental fare.

Reviews.Title: “Don't rely on the shuttle service!!”
Reviews.Author: 497Queenie
Reviews.Content: It is obvious this hotel (in building 2) is there for the use of tour groups as it is closer to the airport, it does not offer much more than a large, clean room. After arriving at the end of our tour of Italy, we had a free day before joining a cruise. The free city shuttle is why I didn't ask to change hotels, however the shuttle service was scarce after 2pm, and after waiting 2 hours for it to arrive, there were enough passengers to fill 2 buses. They do not allow standing passengers, so some were left behind for another 3 hours! Taxis to this remote hotel location, at least 15km from the city, would have cost too many euros. As for meals, well the buffet breakfast was standard buffet fare, no complaints about that really but dinner was pricey, and as they didn't open the main dining room at night, eight of us (3 groups) were seated in lounge chairs at coffee tables, just off the main foyer.Uncomfortable, AND overpriced. There were no facilities to fill the time at this hotel in the complex. A paved courtyard, very hot in August, was used mainly by smokers and that made it very unpleasant, also no shade. An area on the other side which probably should have been garden as it had shrubs and un- mown grass, wasn't accessible.The pool was at building 1, about one km away by shuttle, available when you requested it.We weren't given any information about it when we checked in, and didn't go out of our way to use it. The free computers were in building 1 also. I wrote to the hotel and Trafalgar Tours on returning home. The hotel still hasn't responded 3 months later. Trafalgar Tours at least responded, but the hotel has told them they are in a scenic location and evening meals are provided in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat here”
Reviews.Author: Texastravveler
Reviews.Content: The property is lovely. If breakfast included, by all means eat here. Otherwise, expect to spend at least $50-75 per person for soup (or pasta) and salad with water, a beer or wine. Dreadful pizza at around $25-30. We were promised nightly that the main restaurant would open, but it never did except for groups. So, I am talking spending this kind of money for a coffee shop experience. And not a very good one at that. There is a shuttle into town from 10 a.m. To 10 p.m. Unfortunately, one of us was ill, so deserting them for town was not an option. Stay here only if you are sure you can get away to eat.

Reviews.Title: “4 days for business”
Reviews.Author: Marco B
Reviews.Content: Very clos to Rome Fair Trade Halls and to the airport and therefore out of the city, they have an efficient shuttle service till 22. Taxi to the city center is gonna be 30 €. Rooms are great, tv as well, breakfast is a yummy buffet (and they do a great cappuccino in the kitchen - ask for that insted than taking it from the machine). I come always back if I go to Rome and don't want to get stuck in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but their "Link" area doesn't offer Free Wi-Fi like other Sheratons. :/”
Reviews.Author: DCR0adWarri0r
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased that we were upgraded to a lovely suite at check-in. The staff was able to accommodate us even though we arrived a little early (we got there at 1200 even though check-in is normally at 1500). The Shuttle bus is convenient to reach downtown. It lets you off within a couple of blocks from the historic attractions. Be aware though that the driver may let you off at a different point from where the bus departs later that evening - so be sure to study the map of the pickup point carefully (we waited to be picked up where the driver had let us off. 15 minutes after the 1800 pickup time, we consulted the timetable and realized we were in the wrong place as the bus is supposed to dropoff and pickup across from the Café Antiqo - two blocks up from where we were waiting). :/ I was looking forward to downloading my emails that evening, to work on the 10 hour return flight home the next day. The concierge advised their Link facility was in Building 2, so I grabbed my laptop and took the shuttle van from building 1 to building 2. However I was disappointed to learn the Parco de Medici "Link@Sheraton" doesn't offer free wi-fi. Using one of the workstations in the Link area, I showed the staff that "free wi-fi" is listed on www.sheraton.com as a benefit of the "Link" facilities, but they remained adamant that this amenity didn't apply to their Link facility. :/ All in all though the hotel is very large, suiting the needs of both leisure and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “constant quality and elegance over the years”
Reviews.Author: M2609
Reviews.Content: My first stay was in 1999 (business), the second - more than ten years after (leisure). I left both times with an overall positive impression of reliability and professionalism. Beautiful outdoor pool! (seasonal).

Reviews.Title: “Captive Market Pricing here...”
Reviews.Author: ladybird17
Reviews.Content: As said before, these 3 hotels making up the complex are very isolated, there is absolutely nothing close by. Whilst I've no compalints about the hotel, the prices are very high - 6 euros for a coke, 17 euros for hamburger & chips. But there's not a lot of choice! I had a 6pm flight the day after a conference, and planned on taking the hotel shuttle bus to the shopping mall, as I've done Rome. However, the first shuttle bus didn't leave the hotel until 3pm, so spent the whole day in the hotel garden - which was a treat as the weather was so good for November. But the pool & gardens seem to officially "close" in October so no outside service even if it is hot enough to sit outside. I received good service from the front desk and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort hotel, but quite far from the city”
Reviews.Author: AntoniaHK
Reviews.Content: Lovely, comfortable and clean hotel/ resort. Great for playing golf and close to the airport. I would not recommend this hotel if you are visiting Rome as a tourist though, as it is very far from all of the historical sites. They do have a shuttle bus that runs a few times a day into town, but being Italy, it tends to be a little bit unreliable. For an airport stop-over it is quite good. Nice hotel, lovely food, clean and the staff are very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: PaiaDave
Reviews.Content: We must share our great trip to Italy. At this Sheraton the staff was the best. Sabrina in the restaurant was GREAT. Serena at the front desk treated us great and spoke perfect english. The bartender in the lobby bar was GREAT his first initial was A. and he was working with Anna who spoke spanish, english and italian, she was GREAT. We had a great experience at this hotel and the staff was the best. We loved Sabrina she was great, very sweet and polite. We will be back because of your staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service..”
Reviews.Author: guido l
Reviews.Content: Spent three days with my entire family. It is not always easy to please three kids and a wife who has a phd in complaining!...but they did it.Great service and a top of line facilty ..with a very good shutle service to the airport. Will go back when in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good for its intended use!”
Reviews.Author: TexasCece
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for anyone WITH a car in Rome (it is outside the city on the ring road). We use this hotel regularly for our overnights when departing from Rome FCO on an early flight and It is VERY convenient for that purpose. We have also stayed several times with large family groups as a base to visit the city as nice Rome hotels are quite pricey and this has a little more room to roam (remember that in MOST hotels in Europe you cannot have more than 2 people in a room or there is an extra charge - same is true here) We have stayed in all 3 hotels that make up the complex so have a lot to say. As we usually use starpoints to book this one is a deal to stay at (except when you have to book extra rooms or extra beds for those kids). The pluses: 1-just 10 or 15 min to the airport 2- They do have a free large and comfortable shuttle bus into Rome for those wanting to get one last dinner in Rome or for those who would rather just stay outside of the city. The bus obviously runs on a schedule, so you do have to plan around it. 3. Pools and outside area in buildings 1 & 2 (but not nearly as much as it appears on their website :-) 4. Free parking - but only in buildings 2 & 3 - see minuses for building 1 :-) The minuses: 1. The worst is that you do not know which building you will be in. So you have to guess and drive up to one and go in to reception to find out if you can check in there or have to move on. NOT FUN if you have already unloaded your bags...so this is an IMPORTANT thing to remember! 2. No pool in building 3 - so if you have kids wanting a swim try to request building 2 (if you have a car) or building 1 (if you don't - nicer pool) 3-As other reviewers have said - the food leaves much to be desired - figure out how to get somewhere else for that last memorable dinner!! 4-free parking in building 3 - well basically there is none! They have a pay lot which you have a meter box to pay for (can't even put it on your bill). When we complained and asked about free parking they told us it was across the street. So we looked and only thing we saw is the public lot for the small cinema/eating area that is nearby..BTW-don't go here looking for that last memorable meal..but do stop by and have a look around for the fun of it...not your standard Rome!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Sound and functional, but with issues.”
Reviews.Author: bobwood
Reviews.Content: Not a simple hotel to pass comment on as it is split into three parts which are connected with a mini bus shuttle. We had an executive room in Hotel 2 which was very good...nice lounge area, comfortable 'King' bed and spacious bathroom with a seperate shower. The TV, while being a good size wide screen had a very poor programme selection, no popular sport (football, F1, etc) or even Italian football, only eurosport in German. No BBC World even, only Sky News which becomes repetative after 10 minutes. Food is variable, breakfast in Hotel 2 is overly busy and fast paced with a fall off in quality. All the hot food becomes cold because the lids are never closed on the food warmers, the queues for coffee, toasters and juice dispensers are very irritating, but there are plenty of pastries and cakes to fill up on. For an evening meal Hotel 1 is a better proposition, run by a very efficient and charming restaurant manager, if you are in the hotel for a number of nights chef will cook you a meal of local dishes as the set menu is not at all extensive. I have not mentioned hotel 3 as it was closed through our stay with its entrance blocked off by a car to prevent any one parking there. It is the newest hotel and it is strange to see it standing empty...it is a shame its restaurant was not opened for breakfast at least which would have relieved the scrum in hotel 2. We chose the hotel as a base for Rome and Lazio, for which it is ideal, sitting just off the Rome Ring and airport motorways. We did not drive into Rome although we had a hire car...driving in Rome is requiring nerves of steel - we had an escorted tour for two days, picked up from the hotel, the tours were tailored for what we wanted to see at about £250 a day. That may seem alot but it is well worth it, we chose 'Discovery' tours and our driver/guide could get to places that large groups could only dream of, this cost included a personal guide around the Vatican. We used the Hotel coach on another day which leaves the hotel about every 75 minutes from 10.00, this drops and picks up from near the centre of Rome. Although the coach was not full on the day we used it, I noted on a couple of other days that the early buses do fill, especially if touring parties are in the hotel. On both occasions a back up coach was sent for. We used a car to visit the countryside around Rome...I recommend Lake Bracciano, Ostia, Anzio and Bagnoregio. You do get used to the driving style...honestly...just remember most Italians do not use indicators, do not give way....etc..The motorways are very good, but many of the main roads are in a fairly poor condition. Make sure you have hire papers and driving license with you as traffic police gave me a very difficult 15 minutes while they checked I was who I said I was...they could have fined me for the hire agreement not being in the car. Be careful which layby you stop in to check guide book (satnav is a Godsend here), as young ladies will tap on your window offering services!!...even with your wife in the car!

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient and Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Erin T
Reviews.Content: I usually prefer the Starwood brand, but this hotel does not meet the Starwood standard. It is far enough from the Rome airport that there is no shuttle available but is also far from the city center. They have a shuttle bus, which is nice but it has inconvenient times and my husband and I inadvertantly got on the wrong Sheraton bus (beware!). They told us they would not check us in early based on company policy, even though rooms were available - having just taken a red eye from the US and only picked this hotel because we wanted a day to relax before starting our trip - we were very upset. The restaurant food was okay, but it was overpriced. The bar and pool area are nice though. The rooms are definitely not what you come to expect from the Sheraton brand, but that might be US vs. Europe standards. All in all I will never stay at this hotel again, and plan to warn friends & family to avoid it. You can find cheaper hotels in the city center or near the airport with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, convenient location for business. Used to be better.”
Reviews.Author: maxbass
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in this hotel for the past 10 years since I travel by car and this hotel has easy access and free parking. Over the years, the hotel has grown and it has 2 new buildings. Unfortunately, with the increased size, the service and the restaurant have got worse, especially if you are located in one the "remote" buildings. I had the impression that they didn't cook the food in the same building, but that the meals were brought over from the main building were the kitchen was. The hotel is a bit impersonal, but travelling for business, I don't care. The rooms are still ok and have all the services a business traveller needs. The hotel is located on the Rome ring-road and it convenient if you need to reach the airport. A taxi to the town centre will take 30 minutes at least.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: LynnoP
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton boasts its "Sweet Sleeper Beds". I had a rock hard mattress barely improved by sleeping on the duvet and wrapping it over like a sandwich. The pillows were rock hard as well and when I complained nothing happened. I called housekeeping for a bathrobe and they came with two towels. The walls were paper thin and I could hear the man in the next room coughing. The queue for checkin took 20 minutes and when I ordered a taxi I was told it would be 4 minutes. 25 minutes later I joined another business man who happened to be going to the same place as I was. The room looked nothing like the picture on the internet. It cant have been decorated in years. The bath plug didnt fit properly and within 2 minutes most of the water had drained out of the bath. When trying to call guest services the phone just rings for 2 minutes and then cuts you off. I didnt feel like wasting my breath on explaining to them all the things wrong with their hotel as I feel they didnt care and wouldnt take any notice.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated hotel-okay stay”
Reviews.Author: Lillyindy
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for business. No main complaints about the room. Bedding and pillows were soft. Room had wireless access to the internet with a fee but worked fine. My main complaint is that this hotel is very isolated. It offers a shuttle to Rome city center which does help. However, I needed to pick up a few personal items that I had run out of during my trip. The hotel despite its size has no gift shop. There are no shops nearby. When i explained to the hotel what I needed, their only suggestion was for me to take the hotel shuttle to a nearby shopping center- about half an hour each way. Given that I was there on business, it was not very convenient to have to leave the area for some basic hygiene items. Food was only okay too...

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here if you want to see Rome”
Reviews.Author: MTL1969
Reviews.Content: A mediocre conference and golf hotel. I stayed here for a work meeting- not my choice. There is an infrequent shuttle bus service to Rome but frankly, if you came to see Rome you're much better of somewhere in the city. The hotel caters to lots of business groups as well as people who come to spend time by the pool. The food and drinks were over-priced and, even worse, mediocre. It's a shame that in Italy one has to eat such food when you know there is so much better food available for the humblest trattoria in Rome. The rooms are nothing special- slightly outdated and worn. And like most business hotels, It believes it's OK to rip travelers further off by charging €18 for internet- something that's free in most 1 and 2 star hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from hotel parking”
Reviews.Author: antonio_b1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel together with one partner for a 2 day business meeting in Rome, as I considered it a good business hotel. Wrong assessment! Wired internet, charged 18€/day was so poor that my partner was forced to buy wireless lan access, charged additional 22€/day, which instead worked fine. When I inserted the plug of my laptop at 10 pm into the wall socket in my room, the power went off completely. It took 15 min before a technican came to my room and restored the power. Despite the promise to repair the socket the next day, it was not repaired. The bets "pearl" took place the second day of my stay: I tried to pay the hotel parking: check in day before 7.10 pm. The ticket machine showed a cost of 24€, but did not accept credit card nor cash, so I went to reception: it was 6.55 pm. I had one couple in front of me checking-in. It took 40 min for the clerk to check them in, so I started my dialogue with her at 7.35. Cost now 40€, because it was 24+ hours. No way to get them accept my position, (you kept me here over 40 min waiting!) so after more than 10 min like that, I asked to call the manager, who accepted to charge me 24€ only when I started to raise my voice and threatened to call police. 7.45 pm... I get to my car but cannot get out of parking: the ticket is refused by the bar machine at the exit of parking. Call security, who, again!, was unable to help me: he needed manager approval. I eventually managed to get out of parking at 7.55pm. It took me 1 full hour to pay and get out of parking lot! My customer was furious, and it took me a good dinner to have him improve his mood. Good job Sheraton Golf Parco dei Medici!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, service, 12 miles from the heart of Rome with free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: RangerFortWayne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days at this hotel after a Mediterranean cruise out of Civitavecchia port. We were on a Make A Wish trip for our youngest child, age 16. So there were five of us in our family, including my husband, and daughter, 21, and other son, 18. I mention that, because we had not chosen the hotel, but were very happy with the location. The 12 miles from downtown Rome scared us, but the hotel had a free shuttle that would drop off and pick up at only one location west of the Coliseum. They give you a schedule and you need to watch the times in the evening to return if you want to go in for dinner. But to go anywhere in Rome for the major sites it costs no more than 10 euros for all of us. You must have a cab that will fit 5 people, as most carry 4. It costs no more, but you may have to have a restaurant or the hotel call one for you, especially on the weekends when not as many cabs run in the summer. The beauty of the 12 miles out is that when we had to leave to get the the airport early on the last day, we had a shorter ride to get to FMO airport and then we needed a van called for us and our luggage. That was about 70 euros and we weren't that far, about a 20-30 min ride away. It was 150 euros from Civitavecchia port to the hotel, which the ship allowed us to use their phone to arrange a few days before debarking. I did write a comment that the hotel should provide a shuttle to the airport, but they don't. They had a small van which I inquired about, but they said it wasn't for the airport and couldn't be hired, even though it had their name on it and they must have used it for someone. maybe it only went between the 3 properties. If they had an airport shuttle, I would consider staying there again. As it was, it was expensive enough for the airport van two ways and it would have paid for another night or a fabulous dinner, so in the end, we all weigh our options! The rooms we had were the better rooms near the pool with french doors to the patio, great beds, nice bath amenities, safes, and great cleaning staff. There was an ATM in the lobby, but our cards would never work in them, as it was an Italian bank or euro system only. But a 3 min walk to an ATM in front of the small movie theater, shopping pizza place, stores open late, worked just fine. The hotel wants you to eat in their restaurant at the adjoining golf course, which is very nice but pricey. They told us there was nothing close for restaurants. Later we saw a 20% off for the meals, but our kids and we were very happy one evening with pizza and beers near the movie as I needed the cash for the van to the airport. The Sheraton has 3 properties on this same road that seems to be in the middle of nowhere, but I'm sure you can find things within a mile or two with a cab. I'm not sure about the others, but ours had a wonderful pool, with poolside drink and food service. So refreshing and not crowded after a hot day walking around Rome. There are protected swallows that make their mud nests under the eaves of the hotel and we saw a heron of some type on the roof also. We never golfed, but the course is very nice and we walked before dinner one night along the edge which was so peaceful near the ponds. We do golf, so it is apparent from the club, club golf shop, and restaurant, ( as well as the nice cars parked outside) that this is a nice place. I had envisioned a 15th century hotel in downtown Rome overlooking a piazza, smelling garlic from the restaurant below through open french doors and a flower box laden with geraniums, but the reality is that the shuttle was reliable, the hotel we stayed in was quiet, well run, clean, had a pool, and it is close to the airport, so we were happy with our stay. It was mostly business meetings with many Italians (many Japanese while we were there for a conference and pilots and flight attendants. The hotel was small and the buildings were at most 2 stories high, so not a huge, impersonal, hotel, but rather intimate and the real Italy. Breakfast was a gorgeous buffet. I asked if it was included, which was no, but it was so nice and complete with bacon, eggs, pastries, potatoes, coffees, juice variety, cereals, yogurt, cheeses, etc, that we opted to all eat there and enjoy a meal before the airport food! You have to ask for cafe americano, or you get espresso. Dining staff except for hostess did not speak much English. Dining room had view of the golf course and lawn to the rear of the hotel which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: Drago26
Reviews.Content: Spent there a night on a business trip. Very nice hotel with splendid service. Highly recommend it to business travelers with some time to spend for spa and golf. Just 15 min from Fiumichino Airport, even on a rush-hour.

Reviews.Title: “a real jewel a close to Rome”
Reviews.Author: dravizza
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise: a nice, clean hotel with an amazing service and with a staff making everything to make you feel well and welcome We spend just a night on August 4/5 and the girl at the reception was so incredibly nice and helpful. Every time she saw us during our stay, she greeted with our names and that was very nice. We felt the "pensione" feeling while staying in a big hotel. The room was very big ( quite an exception for Italy), with an amazing bathroom. Breakfast was very good and included in the price. Swimming pool was very nice and elegant Definitely a place we want to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience, not helpful and very costly in the end”
Reviews.Author: kamkjp
Reviews.Content: first of all even though the rooms are new and big, they only allow 3 people per room so a family of four has to spliyt up and get two rooms even though my kids are 6 & 9 and there was a pull-out queen. everything was no no no when we asked, food costs a fortune and the shuttle to the other building, where our room was, took forever and they were just so unhelpful. we booked one room for one night and then had to get a 2nd room when we checked in as no one would budge on their weird policy. so it cost us double. Starwood should be ashamed of itself having this property in their portfolio.. there is potential here b/c the pool and grounds are nice but it needs new mgmt. and yes it felt like stuff would get stolen if you ever left it around the pool or common areas. beware of cabs to/fro airport as it is a short ride but they charge 50 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Shambolic check in”
Reviews.Author: FoxtrotOscar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Rooms were OK - nothing special whatsoever. Check-in was absolutely shambolic with rooms not ready on time, and kept waiting. No ability from management or receptionists to think outside the box - individuals were allocated to specific rooms, which leaves no flexibility. If rooms were allocated on arrival, guests could be given a room that is ready, rather than have to wait for a specific room that wasn't. Morons! Drinks were absurdly expensive. Didn't play on the golf course, but it looked in pretty poor condition and didn't see a single person on it. Other than conferences, I can't really see any good reason to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: pknrajasthan
Reviews.Content: If u want Big spaces < large rooms < great night life just adjacent to hotel < Nice breakfast and comfortable stay near airport then this is the hotel .. Great for groups as its costs lower due to its distance from main city .. Rooms are very Nice < and nice breakfast < The best is that just adjacent to hotel is a very nice lively night shopping places with bars , restaurants , gaming and casino too .. so after a days work you can just walk to this place and unwind .. bathrooms are very very large and pleasantly well equipped ..

Reviews.Title: “Room rate may be cheap but everything else costs a fortune”
Reviews.Author: SheenaandDave
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights after having been in the centre of Rome for the weekend. Is really quiet and comfortable but meals, drinks, snacks, Internet and everything extra is extortionate. Service is also really really slow.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, bad management, lot of thieves”
Reviews.Author: NMSamaha
Reviews.Content: I don't recommend this hotel at all, imagine that my hand bag which contains my laptop, hard disk, camera, GPS, business documents and many personal stuff was stolen from the lobby, I urged the manager to check the CCTV (camera) at the lobby facing the location of the hand bag and he refused, till now my hand bag was not found and no one bothered to respond to me, I didn't care about the money value of the hand bag as much as the personal items inside, I'm quiet sure if the manager had checked the camera at that time we could identified the thief, but he was afraid that thief could be one of his team. it was a terrible stay and experience.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind staying outside of the city centre, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Gmichael315
Reviews.Content: It's about a 20-35 minute drive into the city centre (there's a shuttle that runs for to/from hotel on an hourly basis). Overall, rooms were nice and clean. Nothing fancy at all about the place, but its much cheaper than staying in Rome. Plus you never know where is/isn't safe in the city centre!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but fair from the city”
Reviews.Author: DaliCT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite fair from the city. The good thing is that the hotel provides a free shuttle bus every two hours or so for hotel guests. The ride is about 35 mins. The breakfast spread was quite nice, just adequate. There is also a golf course, they have special rate for hotel guest. I guess if you like golf, you'll like this hotel. Bring your own golf clubs if you want to save some money on rental.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorDermatology
Reviews.Content: First of all there was garbage in front of our rooms. The rooms were all smelly and the air conditioning was not functioning. At the breakfast, you could believe that everything was bought right from Metro and put it on the table. We cannot drink a proper cappuccino in the heart of Italy! It was something with milk-like from a machine (like you see on the street). But most of all do not leave unsupervised your expensive perfumes in the rooms! Two of my colleagues leaved without them! So, be smart and avoid this 4 *hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Looks a Roman ruin from the outside and you have no free phone or Internet.”
Reviews.Author: Verien
Reviews.Content: For the positives it is close to the airport, has a golf course on site, the restaurant and rooms are pleasant and clean. However Sheraton shame on you the outside is a disgrace, mould in the pool, paint peeling of the facade of the buildings, grass not mowed and general lack of interest in the outside appearance of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful - Avoid - Rude staff and charge for all extras”
Reviews.Author: AnnonymousLondon
Reviews.Content: Rude staff, took 1 hour to check in even though late at night. Charge extra for EVERYTHING (€31 euros for English Channels, €16 euros per person per sauna use, €30 euros for breakfast, internet (even if you have Starwood status) Website lies about the cost of getting into the city (Website 25 euros for a taxi to the city, originally told by the staff at the front desk was 50 and then eventually they booked one for 35) Rooms old, bathroom loo roll holder came off, can't open the window. All in all a dreadful stay and dreadfuls start to our trip. Despite only paying $25 a night, I would not go back even at less, a hostel would be better

Reviews.Title: “Good price, clean and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: passionatetraveler20
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, there was no spirit of welcome (quite un-Italian). Though the hotel was not very full, we were told we had to wait until a room became ready. So we waited in the restaurant, only to watch others check-in and go to their rooms. The restaurant is expensive with a very limited menu. Painfully inefficient service. The room was equipped with towels for one person. It took two requests to receive a second pillow and two to receive another towel. They offer good shuttle service into the city but none to the airport. Except for that shuttle, one would feel really isolated unless you had a car. I would skip this hotel on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, excellent base with free shuttle right into the centre of the city”
Reviews.Author: Sofia12Littleborough
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for two nights during May 2011. We hired a car at Ciampino and it is about a 25 minute drive to the hotel. One of the downsides is that they don't allow check in until 3pm, we arrived at 12pm and chanced our arm to be told that the room wasn't ready. We went to the hotel snack bar for a light bite and were shocked at the prices! It cost 50 euros for two small sandwiches and two drinks, but as there isn't anywhere else around the hotel we didn't have much choice. We sunbathed by the pool for the next couple of hours. The pool area is nice and quiet with comfy sun loungers. Check in was very quick and the reception staff are all very polite and helpful. The room was comfortable and clean as was the bathroom. There was nothing particularly special about the room and it was quite small, but like I said it was clean and comfy. The mini bar prices are extortionate, expect to pay around 5 euros for a small bottle of coke! We ventured out to the supermarket which was about 10 minutes drive from the hotel. This is situated in a huge shopping mall which consists of many very nice shops! Anyway, we purchased our own mini bar items from the supermarket here and it was extremely cheap. The breakfast at the hotel was ok. The hot breakfast was rubbish, but if your happy with continental, then there is plenty of fresh fruit, brioche, cheeses, ham etc to choose from. The very best thing about this hotel is the free shuttle into the centre of Rome. It is a bus which holds 48 passengers so there is no fighting to get a seat as I have experienced at other hotels with smaller buses. The bus takes you right into the centre of Rome, right next to the Vittorio Emanuelle building, you really couldn't get more central in fact. So if you want a clean, comfy base with hassle free transport to and from the city, then I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3.5* hotel with 4* star amenities, on city's GRA”
Reviews.Author: apvac
Reviews.Content: This is not the only Sheraton in Rome. If you want a more upscale choice, you can refer to the other "Sheraton Roma" hotel. However this remains a good choice for a good hotel with a moderate price point. If you book in advance you can usually find pretty competitive rates. This premise is necessary to understand my review. I was in building #3, the newest I suppose; other buildings are completely separate hotels with their own reception and facilities. There is free covered (solar panels), unguarded parking on the hotel grounds. Everything was quick and smooth at checkin and checkout. The room was comfortable, wooden floor, quiet and I enjoyed a great sleep. All common amenities for 4* were available: laptop size electronic safe, air conditioning, minibar. The TV was a modern LCD of medium size. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom had all expected amenities, although the usual large facial tissues were replaced by a tiny package of micro paper tissues. In my room the fixed shower was in the bath tub and had a curtain, a less than optimal, although much common, solution. The room and the bathroom felt new and were in perfect conditions; however they were on the small side. Despite the relatively little space, everything found its place; there is a wardrobe, a desk, a little mini sofa. Overall, it was a comfortable room with everything needed but not much luxury, nor much space. This was the standard room "superior", not "deluxe". Breakfast was sufficiently good, choice of yoghurts, limited choice of fruit, good choice of pastries and cakes. However at 7:30 the room was quite busy, the few attendants struggled to quickly clean the tables and serve the guests for special requests. This hotel seems to be popular with large groups and it was fully booked, so the breakfast conditions may be excusable. The price for breakfast, if not included, was moderate (14€ I think), which justifies the available quality and variety. Checkout was sufficiently quick, despite the large crowds from bus groups. If you are looking for a cost effective solution outside of the city (it is near the GRA, the highway ring), this is an excellent choice with international level facilities at a moderate price. If you don't like small rooms, try the deluxe ones. Don't expect top 4* luxury and you will not be disappointed. I see this as a very good choice positioned between the cheaper "four points" and the more expensive "Sheraton". You cannot compare this hotel with top international hotels in the Sheraton chain; it usually is rather cheaper and it would not be a fair comparison.

Reviews.Title: “not Sheraton 4-star standard”
Reviews.Author: FinninEuropeLadybird
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for two and on the bed only one bathrobe. The food at the restaurant greasy. Staff memebrs more interested in critizing guests' behavior than serving. Front desk trainee was put to solve customer complaints. The only friendly person in the hotel was the black doorman. Cannot recommend to my friends even the golf course is locate next door. A lot of work in empowerement and staff training neede!

Reviews.Title: “Put your running shoes on if catching courtesy bus,or boxing gloves!”
Reviews.Author: ayrshireisgreat
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean room and nice big dining room also nice outdoor area although we were told pool closed even though in the 7o,s ,also big dissapointment when we decided to get the courtesy bus into Rome ,we were early about 15mins early ,one of the first in line then bus arrives ,no order ,just a free for all ,pushing and running ,we eventually got on bus and were told to get off no standing room!! told reception ordered us a taxi and seven of us had to pay 70 euro ,so much for free courtesy!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: farfar-n-away
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting in a nearby hotel. So I decided to stay at this hotel instead due to loyalty to SPG. This hotel is huge, with 3 separate buildings. Maybe it's because of its size and number of large tour groups staying there, but service was rather impersonal. No recognition of Plt status aside from asking what Plt amenity I wanted. On check-in, I was not told where or when breakfast was (rate incl breakfast). I was also not instructed on how to use the internet (free for Plt). I had to call Guest Services to get the information. BTW, the free plt internet is LAN only. WiFi is charged. My Plt room: I had a very lovely view of the road outside the hotel. The room and bathroom were very large, esp for Europe. Despite checking in after 5 PM, my room was not quite ready. Housekeeping was still in the room when I arrived. The bed is quite comfortable and the room quiet. Rome was unseasonably warm, in the 80's. Unfortunately, the air conditioner did not work well and none of the windows opened (nights were very cool). Front desk service was OK. Many times, it was understaffed. Despite tour groups and airline personnel checking out simultaneously in the AMs, only 2 ppl were at the desk. The hotel is very inconveniently located. Despite my conference being only 3 km away, taking a taxi was a minimum of 10 euros. Taxis have to be called by the front desk, which starts the fee at 6 euros. I had the misfortune of running into 3 dishonest taxi drivers (out of 6 used!). One claimed that he was not the taxi called for me. He stood around then went to check with the front desk, all the while the meter is running. He then told me he would take me - the starting meter was now 10euros! I refused to go with him unless he reset it. He refused. I got out. One had set his rate at 2 (daytime/weekday rate is supposed to be 1), so the price came out double. i didn't realize this until later. Another had "fixed' his meter to run extra fast. The same distance and faster time to get to my hotel cost twice as much as usual. i had checked that the rate setting was "1". There are no restaurants nearby. So you are stuck with the hotel's restaurants or taking a taxi somewhere or taking the free hotel shuttle bus into central Rome. Breakfast is plentiful but a madhouse. Selection is wide, with both hot and cold offerings. But it was very crowded. All-in-all, this is was a very disappointing stay. Unless I had a conference in this hotel, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel 2 is airport dormitory”
Reviews.Author: cunnungham
Reviews.Content: avoid hotel 2; simply airport dormitory, miles from anywhere. Run the gauntlet of smokers and ashtrays at entrance and join the throng at reeption . food at 1 better than hotel 2.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IndoCanadian
Reviews.Content: I went there for a meeting. Close to airport at Fumicino, but far from centre of Rome - about 30 mins by car in good Traffic. Traffic can be frustratingly slow.The taxi fare is about 30 - 40 Euros .Hotel has free shuttle to downtown Rome - but only a few runs in am and pm. There is a shuttle to the nearest metro about 15 mins away - again a few runs in morning and evening. The taxi is about 10-15 Euro. The metro has a three day pass - 11 Euro - can get only through machine - exact change needed. Overall not a bad place to stay if you plan your transport into Rome properly. The rooms and facilities are what you would expect in a standard Sheraton in NA. No surprises. No reasnable dining options around. Hotel restaurant quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable rooms, friendly staff and great food”
Reviews.Author: Giddu2010
Reviews.Content: The most comfortable hotel stay in my entire Europe trip. Highly recommended. Very friendly staff, very clean rooms and excellent service. Lovely choice of food for vegetarians. The hotel has a bus that takes guests from hotel to the tourist centre mornings and evenings. Remember to tip the driver, else he can frown at you :)

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: holidayfunMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, modern and comfortable. The service was excellent. The pool area was lovely and we enjoyed a drink out by the pool in the evening. The only drawback was the distance from central Rome. It was good for those ending the tour and heading to the airport. The hotel operates a shuttle service which is complimentary. The only draw back was that I had to leave the city at 3pm to make the shuttle which cut into the shopping time  The buffet breakfast was excellent and had a good range of food. Also, for an airport hotel, they should offer a shuttle service to the airport in the afternoon as they only seemed to operate a service in the morning and my flight was at 10pm. An enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Catherine1402
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for mixture business/pleasure. Hotel has three buildings quite a distance apart joined by hotel shuttle. It is a bit confusing as we did not know which one we were staying at. Parco 1 quite old, 2 and 3 more modern. Stayed in Parco 2 in preferred guest floor which was great. Room was lovely with marbled bathroom. Had great rates through booking.com which made it great value for money. We ate some of the time in the restaurant as the hotel is quite isolated. Restaurant food was very good though a bit pricey. If you just want to visit Rome, maybe more convenient to stay in the centre of Rome, though the free shuttle into Rome was very good. Had an excellent break.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location”
Reviews.Author: allen46
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and the rooms are comfortable, but the hotel is miles from anything. There is a small open air mall next door with a movie theater and a bowling alley but not much in the way of dining.The staff was friendly, but don’t expect much in the way of real help. You will need at least 1 hr for check out, even if your bill is pretty clear cut. The lines are long and they move slowly. I gave myself 45 minutes and missed my bus.

Reviews.Title: “READ funtimecruiser REVIEW ON SEPT 10, 2010”
Reviews.Author: SURFER_DUDE44
Reviews.Content: Funtimcruiser just saved me about 30 minutes of typing. This place is great. Bldg 1 is the best. This is also an airline crew hotel, so if you want to see gorgeous girls hanging around the pool area, this is the place to be. If you want the noise and bustle of downtown Roma, then stay there. If you want to cruise the city all day and and come back to a quiet spacious facility, stay here. 10 minutes and 30 euros from airport. Breakfast is the full deal.....you will not need a lunch! Wifi in room is 18 euros....rip off. Wifi in lobby free.....not rip off. Have stayed here several times and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel but poor service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: MichelleTLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as I was disappointed in my stay at Sheraton Golf (2). I stayed in Rome for 11 nights. During my stay I faced many frustrating situations. The check in took a very long time and was not organized (I walked in after a 12 hour flight no greeting by anyone. I stood in front of the reception for at least 5 min with zero acknowledgement). In order to get a taxi you usually have to wait in line then ask for a taxi (a few days I waited for people to check in before I could call a taxi). If you’re looking to be near the downtown area the drive is about 30 min by car. Anytime I needed something whether it was to ask a question or order room service it took forever and most of the staff were unfriendly. Some of this is cultural but I do expect with an international hotel such as Sheraton that there would be proper training and staffing to accommodate guests. The hotel itself overall was clean, modern and spacious. The root cause of the issue comes down to process issues with the hotel itself and service not meeting my expectations. I would have to say that I would not select this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: csains
Reviews.Content: I had read so many negative reviews on this hotel, that I went there with trepidation, and left very happy. I DID stay in Block 1, so I cannot vouch for the other blocks. The room was top notch, the food was excellent, the setting beautiful. It was very pleasant coming 'home' from the excitement of the city to the gardens and pool. The shuttle buses were convenient and we had no problem with getting in and out of Rome. My biggest issue was no free Internet- this is such a ripoff and is common to all 'business' hotels, which is ridiculous considering the reason you are there. This always makes me angry. Oh, and one last thing, Rome is so very beautiful :-).

Reviews.Title: “Great conference location”
Reviews.Author: Cromford
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days at the Sheraton Golf Parco de' Medici Hotel & Resort during a conference. A bit tricky to find as there are several hotels with similar names in the same area. The hotel has a very nice garden and pool - unfortunately I had no time to use it. The rooms were spacious and I felt very comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only disadvantage is the distance to the city centre - the location isn't ideal for a city visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, modern, spacious”
Reviews.Author: Pat_Davis_10
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here. New and spacious, beautifully appointed. Staff was better than excellent. A bit far out - a taxi into downtown Rome was 30 Euros each way, but other than that have absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “i have stayed at better youth hostels”
Reviews.Author: andrews_sameer
Reviews.Content: A little background would help- I am a 26 year old doctor from a very affluent family. As a result I have stayed at some of the world's most luxurious hotels on family vacations. I have also stayed at very basic youth hostels on trips in europe solo/with friends. I will not give subjective opinions on this hotel lest it seems i am being biased or unfairly harsh...just point out some facts which I think are urgently needed to benefit other users of tripadvisor, a website which has benefitted me immensely. Location- in the middle of nowhere. 50 euro by taxi to the airport (in case thats why u were thinking of staying here, incidentally, u can fly low cost from rome to istanbul for that much). 30 minutes to the city centre. no public transportation options. u will never feel u are in rome. they have a golf course, if all you want to do in rome is play golf, good for you! The hilton is better for catching early flights. we stayed for a conference at the fiera di roma...there can be no other reason to stay here...and even then I think we went with the wrong hotel. rooms- spacious and quite nice. but for 314 euro a night, no tea/coffe maker!! no free internet!! go figure! difficult to operate airconditioner. bathroom- and i love this part- obsolete bath fittings. the water plug in the bathtub and basin and bidet ( all 3) cannot be removed by any standard system such as a chain attached to it or the normal push/pull lever behind the tap. so after u've had a bath/wash... explore the murky waters to struggle with the plug with ur fingers to lift it and drain the water!! but they have heated towel racks...how thoughtful! service- this beats everything.. our room was beside the pool with big french windows facing it...and no heavy curtains... so all night the lights of the pool/lawn kept entering with no way to shut it out! they have a special phone line called "guest services"- I guess precisely because the hotel is so devoid of it- we called 7 times, no kidding, 7 times. no use. same the second night, calls to the reception went unanswered. then i actually personally struck up a conversation with the hotel porter who had it fixed!!!! room service- they never pick up the phone. reception- they pick up the phone 1 out of every 3 times. room service gives tea in the room free... but with a 6 euro service charge per cup!!!!!!! no one in the hotel considers english a language worth speaking or understanding!! there is always a mile long line at the reception if you need to ask anybody anything. this hotel is SERIOUSLY UNDERSTAFFED. food- did not bother. there is a pizzeria next door which serves great pizzas. others- nice lawns. good arrangements to sit in the outdoor lawns beside the pool and watch football on a big screen..we were there when spain played portugal... nice touch with a plate of fruits in the room...thats all. our worst hotel experience in 2 weeks in italy. if u think i am biased, pls check my reviews for hotels savoia and jolanda venice, berchielli florence and trilussa palace rome ( will be up shortly)...all found from tripadvisor and excellent. if this is really a Sheraton, china will win the football world cup in 2014!

Reviews.Title: “Big spacious Hotel - very far away from the City”
Reviews.Author: deepakmalik1
Reviews.Content: Rooms were decent sized, amenities were good. My colleagues played a session of Golf one morning and were quite Happy. Breakfast spread was really Big. But stay at this hotel only if you have to do a conference / play golf at a resort in Rome The location was very poor (far far away from the city) and we couldn't imagine how costly it would get to do some sightseeing around the Historic city of Rome while at our conference

Reviews.Title: “It's a hotel”
Reviews.Author: sibeliusLondon
Reviews.Content: Totally without character, this is a hotel mall on the way from the Airport to Rome. A considerable distance from Rome (at least a 45 minute trip by cab), and not near public transport, its a hotel for people using the nearby Fiore Roma congress centre or the golf clubs. Ghastly coffee (in Rome for heaven's sake) unless you order one at the bar, poor quality breakfast, but large clean rooms with comfortable large beds and efficient plumbing. Why do Sheratons persist in charging a fortune for internet access. Take your dongle.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay, but I wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Kim0525
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms... In one, the air conditioning didn't work In both, the shower doors were useless, and the entire bathroom would FLOOD when anyone took a shower Internet was ridiculously expensive The airport shuttle that is advertised only runs one time/day, at 8:00am One good thing is that it is quiet, because it is away from the city It also has a decent, although cold, pool You definitely need a car if you stay here; there are no public transportation stops close enough to walk to

Reviews.Title: “Worst Sheraton experience”
Reviews.Author: MadridClydo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 days, and I am not happy at the end of my stay. This hotel falls very short of what I have experienced in other Sheraton Hotels. First, my room was a very long walk from the reception, restaurant etc. The room size was fine, average by European standards. When I sat at my desk to work on the laptop, there was no power outlet and very little room for even a small laptop. Even now, I am in the cafe and I cannot find a power outlet. Secondly, there was no wireless internet in the room during my stay. I can only get it in the lobby. When I asked to change rooms, the staff said there was nothing they could do. Also, I was disappointed that the pool was closed and the air conditioning was not turned on yet. It turned warm in Rome, so I had to open my windows with no screens and was eaten by mosquitoes. Overall the hotel seems old and has not been modernized with what I would consider standard amenities as a frequent traveler. This hotel is in a business area, not a tourist area, so I would have expected normal Sheraton quality but did not receive it.

Reviews.Title: “A tired and unloved hotel in a quiet location away from the city”
Reviews.Author: sleepseeker2010
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its price and location outside of the city. This was our first time to Rome with a small child and we were keen to have something quiet, but with easy access to the city. The Sheraton Golf had both of these. Negatives: The hotel is quite old and run down and the grounds in particular are in need of some love. Our room had a balcony (of sorts) but with a 7 foot high wall, you could see nothing but sky and only then if you looked directly up! When we stood on a chair we could see the neighbouring block which had been used as a dump for building waste - not very pretty. We ordered room service on the first night as we arrived around midnight. Our meal was terrible, but filled us up, the worst thing was that our room service tray sat outside our door for the next 2 days as did 2 or 3 others along our hallway! There is also nowhere (other than the adjoining golf course) to go in the area so unless you spend all day every day in the city you will be disappointed by the location. We were a little surprised that our room did not have tea and coffee making facilities, nor an iron and board. Positives: The staff on the front desk and all of the restaurant staff were lovely, spoke excellent English and were very accommodating to our needs with a small child. The buffet breakfast was good and included in the rate. Our room was COMPLETELY dark and very sound proofed and the bed was quite comfy so we slept very well. The double brick construction also meant there was no need to use the air con or the heater as it was a lovely temperature inside at all times. The hotel runs a free shuttle bus (48 seater coach) to the city each day on a very regular schedule. This was fantastic and another reason we chose this hotel. The drivers were never friendly, but the coach was clean and comfortable and meant we didn't need a car at all. Our room was clean on arrival and serviced well each day. The free internet in the lobby was also a big plus and we used this most days.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Aiport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lookingglass101
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night before heading to the airport. Pros: Large rooms, big beds and bathroom. Clean Staff was friendly Has shuttle to airport leaves at 8am only once a day (was about 20 mins late) Breakfast included (decent pastries, meats/eggs were poor) Cons: Location, depending on what you want. Good for a one night airport stay but not near the city. Other: 35Euro cab ride from airport Staff said it take a few mins to call a cab to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For the non-golfer, not too special”
Reviews.Author: bkeith
Reviews.Content: Sure, the hotel has pool and golf. Yes, you get Starwood points. However, this is not a high end experience like a Westin, and the rooms / beds / accomodations are nothing special. I rate this place adequate. Note, transportation to the airport is expensive [38 Euros] and to downtown about the same. Unless you have a rental car, be ready to spend for the local transport, because the hotel shuttles are rare and not necessarily well timed with activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but on the outskirts of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: yellowrose4606
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and a great place to stay if you are driving or leaving for the airport the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for us golf players!”
Reviews.Author: Achille C
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, as we went to play the finals of a golf tournament. We liked very much the hotel - the room was large enough for us (two people), very clean and quiet; comfortable beds, climatization of the room OK, we had no complain at all about the accomodation, thumbs up at all for the room. The breakfast was very, very good, with a great choice of italian/international favorites; the breakfast restaurant has a nice, relaxing atmosphere. Must say that my experience with the personnel at the reception was quite different than other reviews; everyone we've been in touch has been very kind and attentive. The only upset we had was the prices at the bar; simply ridicolous. We paid 50 euro for 3 grappa and 1 beer. We thought it was wrong, but we discovered it wasn't! We recommend to go at golf club bar, it's next door and more reasonably priced. The hotel is simply great if you go to play golf, but I am not sure it's the best choice if you want to visit the city, as it is quite far away from downtown and traffic can be a real problem (read: big delays)

Reviews.Title: “Stamp Show”
Reviews.Author: generalniot
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place to stay, nice stuff. Room service snacks are expensive, but this is Sheraton people :-)

Reviews.Title: “For golf and city vacation”
Reviews.Author: hansenbettina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a bit out of the way between the city and the airport which may put some people off. But it is a scenic place with a nice swimming pool and obviously golf courses right next door. There are free shuttle buses to downtown all day, so the location is not really that big a problem. Stay here if you like to play golf and you want to visit beautiful Rome at the same time, if you are just here to see the city you are probably better off closer to the center which also comes at a higher price!

Reviews.Title: “Crap service and crap quality”
Reviews.Author: Larry1968
Reviews.Content: Rooms extremely small. Booked a twin room, received first a double room with a extra bed...no excuses. The twin room we received was extremely small. Airconditioning was non-existing...it shut off within 5 minutes you had turned it on. Service was lousy..... The reception was so overcrowded all the time that you could not get any service and ..and when you got it it was BAD. Prices in the bar...8,50 EUR for a Beer.....yes that is right, 8,50. I do not understand their pricing. A beer was 3,5 at the golf club, which is owned by Sheraton, but 8,50 in the hotel bar = switch and bait!!!! All in all, they have a good location with good possibilities to offer a super product...and what do they do = the do not offer value for money!

Reviews.Title: “The male staff arrogant, expensive crap food, dirty carpets in rooms”
Reviews.Author: stvoss
Reviews.Content: We know after being in Rome that unless you are paying high price you cannot expect the best, but the discusting service at the front desk, the filthy dirty room, and it was an upgrade to a suite, also the attitude when we politely asked them to find us a clean room was at best arrogant. The cost of food and drink is out of control and that may explain why we hardly saw anybody eating or drinking here unless they were conference people. We are long term gold SPG members but that does not mean a thing here. We will never return and will advise others to be aware

Reviews.Title: “Extremely bad service and over priced”
Reviews.Author: wallyspain
Reviews.Content: I was only there for one night before traveling further, I expected from sheraton to have good service, but unfortunately this was absolutely not the case. They were to busy with checking in a convention that the ordinary guest who most likely pay more, had to wait up to 30 min at the reception, this i find completely inacceptable. Drinks at the bar were over priced and bar staff extremely unfriendly and didnt speak much other than Italian also a min point for being a Sheraton. Room service...well after calling 3 times with no answer i went to the reception, were they reluctantly took my order which arrived after 45 min. All in all not a very pleasant experience, and certainly not up to the standards i am used from them

Reviews.Title: “No service at all”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamSquirrel
Reviews.Content: Very unfriendly staff, they do not care about service at all. Charge for everything (Wifi is very expensive). Breakfast and other meals we had was terrible, very bad quality. Drinks in the bar extremly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have seen in years!”
Reviews.Author: piet_heinAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: If you think Sheraton stands for service, think again. The arrogant Italians service rubbish food and (what they should be known for) the worst espresso and coffee I have ever seen. The breakfast is set up with scrambled eggs coming from powder with either milk or water, crappy croissants, and brown salad. The rooms had windows that could not open, the carpet had stains in it which made me doubt if I should take off my shoes. Very very very dirty. I would not do it. My experience started with waiting for 3,5 hours for check in. Once never again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Hotel burt far”
Reviews.Author: JPAU
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Golf on our last night as part of a Trafalgar tour (Italian Holiday). The hotel was clean and modern but a long way from the downtown area. The room was very modern and clean. The breakfast in the hotel restaurant, included with the tour, while not outstanding was very good.

Reviews.Title: “no regrets/ many bouquets”
Reviews.Author: docthomas
Reviews.Content: i had heard that the staff would not be helpful and that wasn't true at all. i was VERY pleased ... the asst manager Ms Moore was a jewel and showed her desire to please...even got a large fruit plate/wine/munchies for filling out an evaluation form. the shuttle buses for old roma don't start until 10 am and i think they are contemplating an earlier departure. there is still no free internet in # 3 building(newest) but there is over in #2 i was told. the rooms in #3 are 4 star at least and i was most pleased. i think this is a better hotel than the sheraton roma... i visited it and the front desk fjolks there were horrible and rude... the 2 sheratons apparently aren't related in any way and there is NO shuttle bus from one to the other. i liked the parco de medici sheraton very much.

Reviews.Title: “They double charged me and I am still waiting for my money back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonLeoncina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite ok but nothing amazing and quite pricey, especially if booked directly with them. But they double charged me and i am still waiting for my money back!!!! This is absolutely outrageous! i have been calling literally everyday, leaving my mobile number to be recontacted but nobody ever bothered. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for being in transit”
Reviews.Author: BCtraveler44
Reviews.Content: Big american style hotel, transit hotel for ceuise ships and other tours. Many busses. Breakfast was great if a little picked over. Prepare for above average priices for the dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was ok; the shuttle bus is not”
Reviews.Author: A_Lana_A
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome with my mom last Summer 2006, along with the rest of the flight attendants she was working with, since my mom is a flight attendant, and I decided to go along with her since I've always wanted to go to Rome. The hotel we all checked in to is this hotel. As we checked our room, it was alright. The only thing is it's kinda small. But it doesn't matter, since I was ok about it & just the right room for both of me & my mom. And so, both of us went to the center of Rome & went sightseeing. Now here's the horrible thing that happened to us. It started raining that afternoon, and both of us were rushing to the shuttle bus to our hotel. Then, when we arrived at the spot of the shuttle bus, we saw some people trying to get in the bus, but were pushed over! I don't know what was wrong, but I guess it's because the bus is so full. So, with people still trying to get in the bus, the bus suddenly left us! I mean, it's not the proper way to treat a guest of that hotel! Don't they realize that someone could get hurt in a very dangerous situation like that, especially in a rainy day, where people are most likely to fall off in a slippery road? So, what did we do? We just took the other shuttle bus to Sheraton Roma, and from there, we just took a taxi cab to Parco Medici. As we arrived at the Sheraton Roma, my mom convinced me to go along with some of the flight attendants she was working with, who also stayed at Parco Medici. Then, as we arrived at Parco Medici, the flight attendants started complaining like crazy about the hotel's shuttle bus! I want to complain about it too, but I guess it'll be ok in the next day. Overall, the bus coordination was only the problem. Though, everything went ok in the next day. Staffs in Parco Medici are now checking the guest's card keys to make sure that they really are guests in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel outside Rome”
Reviews.Author: resorttrip1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new building 3 and liked it. We had a very nice and stylish room in the upper floor. The service was very friendly. It's near the autostrada, parking is free. The hotel shuttle brings you in about 30 min. to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Sept 2008 when I attended a conference. There were many problems with the hotel. As mentioned by another reviewer, the hotel comprises 3 buildings, about 800m to 1.5km apart. When you book, you are not told which building to arrive at & can go from one to the other until it is solved. I arrived at 10pm & the staff in Bldg 2 told me to walk in the dark, on a public road to get to Bldg 3. It was only when I insisted, that they offered me a lift in the hotel's shuttle car. The second day I was there, there was no water for several hours - the staff seemed uninterested in the problem, rudely saying "it will be back on in 1 hour". Another reviewer has mentioned the lack of ironing facilities - if you stay in Bldg 3, you have to walk about 800m to Bldg 2 to use the single iron available. Many times in the week I stayed, I called the "Guest services" number, but it was never answered. One day my room wasn't serviced when I arrived back at 9pm. Despite staff saying they'd service the room immediately, it still wasn't serviced at 10pm. After complaining a second time, it was finally serviced. The Hotel supposedly has a Turkish Bath/Sauna complex, but it is closed. Others in my conference group also had problems, such as: burst water pipe, flooding room. In shower, only scalding hot water available. Lost luggage - luggage that did not arrive on a flight was apparently delivered the next day to the hotel (airline apparently had a receipt proving this), but hotel denied having received luggage. Took several days to "find" the luggage & hotel manager apparently wasn't helpful, telling guest rudely "just claim on your insurance". The Hotel is isolated. There's really nothing around, except parched fields & an expressway. There is a small cinema complex about 2-3km away - I never went - movies apparently only in Italian. The hotel offers a shuttle bus to/from Rome, but the times are a little limited. I heard guests say they had turned up for the bus in Rome, but it was full, so they had to take a taxi from Rome to the Hotel (about 30 euros). Breakfast buffet is modest, but there's nowhere else to obtain food. On a positive note, in Bldg 3, the rooms are new, modern & spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Teething troubles Sept 2008”
Reviews.Author: Heiny
Reviews.Content: "We are very sorry, we have only recently opened and we are still working some things out..." You will hear this a lot if you stay for long at the Sheraton Golf in Rome, which at the time of writing had been open 20 days. The staff are doing the best under the circumstances, but as a guest, you'd be better staying somewhere else until the kinks are ironed out. Arrival experience: the resort is divided into three main buildings, without proper walking paths between them, and all about 500m to 700m apart. Problem 1 is that when you book, you are not told which of these three buildings, each with it's own reception area, you are booked into. You can only find out by trial and error. I tried all three, dragging my baggage between them, before I got lucky. There was a large conference group at the resort when I stayed for three days, and having found the right building, check-in took 20 minutes of queuing. Services: Broadband internet in the room via cable was not working, but via wireless was. Unlike some hotels in Italy, it is an extra charge of 22 Euros per day. Connection was quite straightforward. Unlike getting a shirt ironed. Despite the hotel services brochure stating overnight laundry service is open until 10pm, it was closed when I inquired at 8.30pm. I then asked if I could have an iron and ironing board sent to my room. This was not possible either. The only option was to use a makeshift 'ironing room' (actually a staff locker) in, you guessed it, one of the other buildings. Another 500m hike, just to iron a shirt. Shuttle buses: There are shuttle buses to drive guests between the three buildings, but they are 'on demand' and are too few, so that waiting times can be so long you are better off hiking yourself. Other similarly spread-out resorts have regular shuttle runs between buildings and attractions, and the Sheraton Golf doesn't seem to offer it yet. Walkways: As mentioned, the quickest way to get between buildings may be to walk, but the resort is not designed to allow you to do so. To get from my building to the building where I had to do my ironing, I had to walk through a carpark, across a road with no pedestrian crossing, and through a dark car park. I would not recommend this to single ladies. Room appointments: are new, and comfortable, with spacious rooms as other reviewers have mentioned. The hot water in the shower has temperature settings that only seem to vary between HOT and VERY HOT, so washing my hair was a scalding experience. Airconditioning was thankfully quiet and did not wake me from the hard earned sleep I fell into after dragging my bags all around the resort...

Reviews.Title: “A Smart Place to stay as a launch point to Italy”
Reviews.Author: Italy_Travellers33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mainly because we got the room on points. It was expensive as others point out, but if you are approaching Italy via Rome, it was just what we needed in terms of a restful stay before moving about the country.
