It's close to the airport (which is a plus if you don't know the country and are bone tired from a transatlantic flight). They got us up to our room in record time. One note: we had done our booking online and indicated that we had two kids. That detail seemed to be missed and created a bit of a problem. But the manager solved the issue for us to our satisfaction. Do doulbe check with the hotel directly if you are traveling with kids. We found the shuttle service to Rome via bus to be fantastic. I didn't think it too long (but then, were from a big country). Kids loved seeing the city all the way in. The shuttle drops you off within walking distance of most of the major attractions and metro system. They even picked us up when we returned to Rome with all our luggage and took us back to the hotel the night before we left Italy. We liked the service. The room was clean and neat, good showers and a great bed (very comfortable). The staff was very helpful and accommodating. Our kids are below 7 years of age, so this place was a very good place to relax and recharge.

Reviews.Title: “Not an ideal choice”
Reviews.Author: technotraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at this Sheraton while attending a conference at the hotel. Overall, my impression of the hotel was that it was overpriced and not very adequate in many respects. Here are the pros and cons, from my point of view: PROS: 1) New construction and the rooms were impeccably clean. 2) Ample breakfast although very expensive if it were not part of the conference. CONS: 1) Far from anything that Rome has to offer. They do have a shuttle bus but it is a lengthy ride to town. 2) Very overpriced....eg. a 300 ml. bottle of water cost 3 euros while it costs 0.15 euros in a grocery store. 3) The golf course is nothing to write home about....and why would you go to Rome to golf anyway? In the 3 days, we saw zero golfers. 4) Staff is moderately unhelpful which I found was unusual for Rome where generally people are very helpful. 5) Conference facilities are fairly limited. The rooms were somewhat undersized for the meeting. In summary, I'd recommend looking around for something better if you're planning a stay or conference in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “American comfort and space in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Golf near the airport for one night on the last day of a Trafalgar bus tour. It was a smart choice because the Sheraton Golf is a modern, clean, well-managed hotel. Space in our room was adequate with a large screen TV, good choice of free channels, a comfortable double bed, writing desk, and a convenient place to sit against the opposite wall when tying shoes or talking to the person lying on the bed. It made maximum use of space. The bathroom was large with the shower in the tub and a couple of sachets of handi-wipes on the bidet. The soap was in the shape of golf balls (see photo). To save space, the bathroom door had a hinge that made it open obliquely like a half-sliding, half-normal door. The breakfast included everything we wanted such as eggs, yoghurt, cereal, fresh fruit, and so on. They took our ice pack and froze it in the freezer (not refrigerator) without any problem. The Kleenex tissue was small--about half of a normal tissue in size. It is probably part of a trend toward smaller canned drinks, cars, bars of soap, and bags of peanuts. We would recommend the Sheraton Golf. It has a free shuttle that takes you into the center of Rome. For those who do not need to return to their hotel until the end of the day, it is a good way to see Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Hotel and golf course outside Rome”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_PD
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel for conferences etc. Nice golf course and pool. A €25 taxi ride into Rome (but they do have a courtesy bus also). Rooms ok but basic. Room rate €248, high for the quality of hotel. The details are missing...magnetic keys kept failing; poor paint jobs on hotel room walls; breakfast room tables unstable etc etc. Good conference facilities

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel! Great access to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: EJPVA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Rome airport...it is like new, rooms are very nice, the lobby and restaurant are excellent. They have a good business center, with international internet access. Even better, they operate a bus/shuttle to the historic area of downtown Rome, so you can enjoy touring without worrying about finding parking -- not only is the shuttle free, the driver even refuses tips! While not inexpensive, this hotel is worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: ancastergreek
Reviews.Content: Was at a conference held in this hotel. Decent room, clean. Food was great. Location could be better. I little time consuming to take the shuttle bus downtown to see the attractions, depending on the traffic. Close to airport. Staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Badly managed chain hotel.”
Reviews.Author: schaefch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Golf Parco de'Medici during a business trip to Rome. As there are two hotels with the same name, it happened that the taxi brought me to the wrong one (the reservation did not indicate which one). Received by some unfriendly staff, I was told in broken English that I had to walk to the other hotel. It turned out to be about a kilometer in the end. The hotel can only be described as average. The worst thing is that the staff does not really care about the guests. A first drink in the bar was served fairly rapidly (at 8 EUR for a small beer that should be expected), but then the three guys at the bar seemed more involved in their chat then checking for seconds. Well, should you try to call reservation and change something on an existing booking, it might take a few attempts, as the staff on the phone might just hang up on you when you speak English. A reservation cannot be changed without a cancellation charge of one night, which is why I will stay at a different hotel next time. Fazit: If you are part of a Chinese tourist group or like to wear your chequered golf trousers while competing with the former at the breakfast buffet, this hotel might just do. If you would like some simple friendly service in a decent atmosphere, avoid the Golf Parco de'Medici.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: ellie0916
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel last december for our honeymoon. This was the last city on our trip so we were pretty exhausted by the time we got here and since the hotel seemed empy it was pretty quiet and we had a relaxing stay. Check-in was kind of slow because the employee at the front desk was in training. This was fine though because he was very friendly. We stayed in the new building. Our room was rather small but modern. We ordered room service and the food was terrible and expensive. I would recommend buying food in the city, it is cheaper and much better. Breakfast was included with our room and it was so so. Mostly fruit and pastries. The free bus service to the center of town was very convenient. All in all our stay was nice and relaxing. No real complaints for the price other than the food.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: KittyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Sheraton Golf was very disappointing. I was there with a tour company called Trafelgar and this was part of the package. My room was broken into and a significant amount of money and valuables were stolen. The day manager was not very helpful and gave me the wrong information for reporting a crime. Subsequently, I have attempted to contact the Sheraton and again no one will help me. They suggestedI call the Sheraton Golf Hotel directly, which from California is very expensive and since I did not have any luck with the management in person there is no reason to believe they will assist me now. A hotel that does not protect their customers and offers no assistance if their patrons are violated ,is not a hotel that an American should feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Sheraton Golf Parco”
Reviews.Author: MaCherie57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic place to stay if you prefer to stay outside the city. We do, and have stayed here for long weekends in June 2006 and in June 2007. Given how hot, crowded, and uncomfortable it can get in Rome in the summertime, there is nothing like coming back to this hotel and relaxing with a swim in the large pool here. Unlike most hotels in the city, this hotel is not lacking for land, therefore the rooms and grounds are very spacious and comfortable. The free shuttle that leaves from the hotel for central Rome about every hour and a half, from early morning until late evening, is a nice touch. You are dropped off in a good location, just a couple of minutes walk from the Forum and other tourist attractions. We highly recommend it, especially if it happens to be available through the Cash and Points program through Starwood Preferred Guests; there's a deal that you cannot beat!

Reviews.Title: “pricey but nice”
Reviews.Author: kleim27
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times, and I must say that I have been pretty satisfied overall. The rooms are very clean, the staff is very polite and discreet, and the food is good and well presented. One of the downsides is the location, pretty far from the city but there is a free shuttle. All in all I would recommend it for value.

Reviews.Title: “My best Trip”
Reviews.Author: GraSpain
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and quiet. Courtesy bus to the train station was convenient and on schedule on every trip. It was a wonderful trip and our accomadations were comfortable and convenient to all of our trips into Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: MBrennanATL
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to write much because "timman19 May 28, 2007" pretty much said it all. We stayed in the new building, which was very nice. Upgraded to a suite, huge bathroom with wonderful bathtub (even by american standards), cute vanity packets, nice bed. Scrubby golf course. I would not stay here to visit Rome. Why when there are so many nice hotels in the city? Unless you are using Starpoints for a free stay, then it might be worth it. They do have a free shuttle into town. I just think it would be irritating to have to use that transportation all the time. You couldn't easily come back to your room to rest after touristing, bathe, then go to dinner, then have to get back later. Just too much transportation to be worth it. Very convenient to the airport. We stayed here after a cruise, catching a flight the next day. I agree wtih everyone that food is ridiculously expensive here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: MMA0723
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our last night in Rome since we had an early flight. I wish we hadn't - it ended a wonderful trip on a sour note. The place is drab and dreary. The food is way overpriced: salad, sandwich 4 drinks $125 US!

Reviews.Title: “not too good”
Reviews.Author: adrigg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel as part of a tour group in june and were dissappointed with our stay. The first room we were allocated we could not get into, after waiting half an hour outside we were told that it would take another hour to fix. We then insisted on another room and ended up in a musty room which was far inferior to the first. We decided to order a chicken sandwich in the bar, (15 Euro) and the bread was stale. We later found out the hotel consists of 2 sections and that the section we stayed in caters mainly for tour groups.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey/ok”
Reviews.Author: Lovvers
Reviews.Content: Came here on business. The hotel is a way out of the city and it took over an hour to get to the centre by taxi during the busy periods. The room was ok - but had a persistent damp patch in the main hotel on the floor. The air con also didn't work properly and I ended up not sleeping because of the heat - not what you want when you have an important business meeting the next day. We ate in town but agree with the overpricing of the hotel. 24 euros for 3 beers!! We enjoyed however, a nice early business meeting by the pool. The hotel has what you need some as high speed internet etc. I wouldn't stay here for a holiday or out of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Americansportswriter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of a week-long tour of Italy and it was a nice finish by the airport and the best of six hotels overall. It's 15 minutes from downtown and not much around it so use it for coming or going from FCO airport. Rooms were clean and big by Italian standards. Huge lobby but most of all a top-notch staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay Even If Not In Downtown Rome”
Reviews.Author: timman19
Reviews.Content: This is a rather nice hotel located roughly halfway between the airport and downtown Rome. There are two buildings here spaced pretty far apart due to the golf course that is between them. We stayed in the older building known as the club house building and the newer one is called the golf building. This review is based on our experiences in the older building. For some reason, the Sheraton website does not mention that there are two buildings. You also have no idea from your reservation which building you are in. If you do arrive at the wrong one, they will drive you over to the other one. We were lucky as we did arrive where we were supposed tobe. Room: We had a junior suite. It featured a bedroom, living room and full bath. There was good closet space with plenty of shelves but not enough room for our baggage. We were able to put them out of the way though which was fine. Our room and the other rooms have an Italian flare to them whereas the rooms in the newer building look more modern at least on the Sheraton website. The room was kept very clean and there were enough towels for us. When you arrive, they give you a little bag for toiletries containing a razor, shaving cream, mouthwash and a comb. There’s one for women and one for men. They also give you slippers and a robe which was a nice touch. There is a mini bar in the room but don’t touch that unless you really need to. The prices are high. There are no vending machines to be found here so if you get really thirsty, you may pay a high price. The hotel area is very quiet at night as was the building itself. There is a pool and a garden area which was very nice. The pool was a bit small and not very deep but good for cooling off after a hot day in downtown Rome. Food: There is a free breakfast buffet each day. It was fine. It has eggs, bacon and sausage as well as plenty of pastries and danish. It was fine but during an eight night stay, got pretty boring. There is a restaurant in the old building. We ate there on our first night as we were tired and didn’t want to go anywhere. The food was fine as was the service but the prices are way too high. The same goes for the bar and pool service where a burger will run you around $20 American. Bar prices were also pretty high. If you are in the old building there is a shopping area nearby and is about a five minute walk. There you will find a supermarket, which is very handy to get drinks and snacks for your room at very low prices. By the movie theatre, there is an American style bar and a pizza place. Both are good and the prices far lower than at the hotel. The pizza place was better. Both are full of locals so if you are a tourist, it’s a nice experience. Service: The front desk staff were fine. Our room was not ready when we arrived due to it being a Saturday and a lot of people were checking in or checking out. That took an hour but we were given complimentary drinks from the bar while we waited. The front desk staff all speak English well and are very helpful. The bell staff, cleaners and wait staff speak enough English to at least get by. Airport Transportation: Coming in, you’ll have to take a cab. It will cost you about 40 Euros. We lucked out as I spotted someone from the hotel walking around wearing a Sheraton Golf uniform. He was helping with guests going on a cruise who were staying there for one night. He was making sure that they were getting on the right bus to the hotel. I asked him if we could do that. He said no but said he would be glad to give us a ride in the hotel van. We did that and I tipped him 10 Euros as a thank you which is what I think he was looking for anyway but it saved us 30 Euros which was nice. Leaving, there is a free bus at 8:00 a.m. from the hotel. That didn’t work for us as we had an earlier flight home. It cost us 55 Euros in the cab. That’s more than usual but they were still charging night fees. It takes around 15 minutes to get to or from the airport. Downtown Transportation: There is a free bus that runs roughly every 90 minutes. It leaves you in a pretty convenient location that is not far from the Colosseum or the Roman Forum. The first one leaves at 9:00 a.m. and the last one back is at 10:45 p.m. It’s a big bus and we never had a problem getting a seat. They are sometimes late going back due to traffic but it will show up. If you miss the last bus, a cab back will run you about 50 Euros. The drivers were fine. The guy in the morning was okay but watch out for the guy at night. He can be a bit nasty at times but usually was pretty pleasant. If the traffic was bad, he was grumpy. There is a café by the bus stop. This is very handy if you just missed one and you can have a cold drink, snack or an ice cream while seated outside while you are waiting. There are also some good restaurants right in that area which are conveniently located a short walk from the bus. A few times, we went back early, cooled off in the pool, showered, changed and took the bus downtown for dinner and back again. A lot of people do this. The last bus at 10:45 arrived like clockwork each time. You can get a taxi from the hotel but be careful. If the front desk calls one for you, the cab’s meter starts running when the call is received. Don’t be surprised to find a few Euros on the meter when it arrives. Depending on the time of the day, your best bet is to wait in front as, during the day, plenty come in and drop people off. At night or early in the morning, you will have to have the font desk call for one. Tours: The front desk can book bus tours from Rome for you. We took three. The company will pick you up but not always at the hotel due to its distance. Twice, we had to go to the Sheraton Roma which is about a five minute cab ride that will cost roughly 12 Euros. We had one pick up from the hotel but they never showed up. When I told the front desk, they called the company who sent a taxi to take us there at no charge to us. If you do a tour, have the bus company drop you off at the stop for the hotel bus when you get back to Rome. That will save a cab ride from the Sheraton Roma and allow you to get dinner in Rome before heading back. On one occasion, the bus company told us they would drop us off there and that was fine with us. Guests: During the weekdays, the hotel was roughly split evenly between tourists and business travelers. The hotel is popular for business conventions and there is a big office complex nearby. The hotel is also used for overnight stays by touring companies or tourists who are going on a cruise. The front desk and lobby area can be very crowded and noisy when they arrive or depart. Overall, a nice stay and I recommend staying here. Be careful with the prices in the bar and restaurant and take full advantage of the downtown bus. We very much enjoyed our stay here. Sure, it wasn't that close to downtown Rome but easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Very Inconvenient Location”
Reviews.Author: JellybeanSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Sheraton for the Rome portion of our trip. We had gotten a good priced Expedia package. I knew the hotel wasn't in Rome central, but felt comfortable because of the shuttle and what I believed was relatively close proximity to Rome. I made a horrible mistake in booking a room here. First of all, we found out that there were really two parts to the hotel, the older hotel and the newly renovated hotel. Can you guess which part we were in? One of the reasons I booked at this Sheraton was because it was advertised as modern with air conditioning. There was nothing 'modern' about our room, and the AC was so weak that we had to open the window, but was forced to close it because we were getting mosquito bites. We informed the front desk, they sent someone over to check it out. While it was slightly better, it still didn't cool our room very much. It was quite warm when we were there at the end of April. There were alot of big tour groups that came in, I think to just spend the night before heading out to the airport. Breakfast was included with our room, and it was a really decent breakfast, but it got quite crowded with the tour groups and lots of stuff was always running out. The worst WORST part of it was the shuttle that takes guests to Rome. The shuttle, actually a big tour bus that seats 48, departs every 90 minutes, starting at 9am. I initially thought it would be quite ideal, to stay in a quiet place, have a leisurely breakfast, then take the free bus to explore Rome. Well, there were more guests then seats, and if you couldn't elbow your way into the bus, you were just out of luck. You either would have to wait 90 minutes for the next shuttle, which could also be full, or take a taxi in, which was about 20 to 25 euros. The bus sometimes came nearly full because its first stop is at the newly renovated part of the hotel that is about a quarter mile away. So once you're in the bus, you're driven into Rome, which was about a 30 minute drive. We were dropped off at the same place only two out of the 6 days we were there. It is not a problem if you're dropped off and told your drop off point is also your pick-up point. Not helpful when you have to take a taxi into Rome because the shuttle is full and that is the day they decide to switch locations. The service wasn't horrible, it was a great value to have a breakfast buffet included, the room was a typical European room that came with a TV and a decent sized bathroom with a tub/shower. All in all, it wasn't too bad, but our experience with the shuttle casts a negative shadow on our memories of our stay. Unless the only reason you're in Italy is to golf, don't stay here. You can find a comparable hotel for the same amount in Rome Central.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton should be ashamed of the service here”
Reviews.Author: Clevelandtravelers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the last night of our 3 weeks in Italy, because it was close to the airport. We arrived about 9 at night, after travelling be train from Venice. The desk clerk told us that we would have to check in at the "other" building" , but that their shuttle would take us there. After eating a mediocre meal in their restaurant, we and our luggage were shuttled to this other building about 1/4 mile from the main building. We were checked in at the "other" building, and then told that we would have to go back to the main building, because that's where our room was. All this "to-ing and fro-ing" took about 45 minutes, and at close to 11 PM we finally got into our room, which reeked of cigarette smoke and only had 1 bath sized towel for the two of us. At $190.00/night We expect better front-desk organization that we had. We had an early morning flight the next day. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid ! (only for meetings or emergency)”
Reviews.Author: DUKE_CLARENCE
Reviews.Content: OVERALL: AVOID IF NOT STRICTLY NECESSARY (e.g. business meeting, flight cancelled as it's close to rome airport) Stayed at this property for business reasons, 1 night, 9 may 2007. HALL&BAR: poorly furnished , low ceiling, cheap materials used RECEPTION: SLOWEST check-in , no queue, but takes 20 minutes to fill pages from your ID card ROOM: poorest furnishing and finishes (mimicking a ikea style cote d'azur decor), everything really cheap (e.g. cheapest wood for closets and materials in general ), ugly decor designed for tourists. RESTAURANT: true rip-off. high prices 60-70 euros a meal (rome-wise) and low quality AVOID !!! if not really obliged to go (besides is far away from rome centre)

Reviews.Title: “Dull, functional and utterly forgettable”
Reviews.Author: Queen_of_NW2
Reviews.Content: I hope you're not a golf widow staying at this hotel. If so, you got a poor deal. Ok, it's Italy, but still a 20-minute cab ride to Rome, and stuck in dull suburbs. The rooms are functional, but there's no plushness, romance or noticeable extras in sight. It's clean, the water's hot, there's wifi, the staff are fine. The food is a disappointment in a country noted for its cuisine. Go here if you must (eg: if chosen for a business meeting), but don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: AlvaroLuis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in early March. We arrived around 5 p.m. after having fought with the airline at the airport for loosing our luggage. Check in was quick. Over the next couple of days lobby personnel was very helpful in contacting the airline repeatedly (in Italian... something I could have not done) until our bags finally arrived. The room was very comfortable, on the fourth floor, with a small fridge, flat screen tv, internet service, and a small patio. Most tv channels were in Italian (obviously) but there were a couple in English and one in Spanish. We tried the hotel's restaurant for dinner on the second night. Excellent food and service but way too expensive. The shuttle will take you to and from the city center (Piazza Venezzia) starting at 9 a.m. until around 10 p.m. every 45 minutes or so. Be there on time or will have to wait for the next one. There is a supermarket close to the hotel, next to The Village (small shopping plaza)

Reviews.Title: “Short Golfing Break”
Reviews.Author: UkNicky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this golf resort having booked a 'golf package' on line. The price we were quoted of 116 euro per night for a 3 night stay, inc b/fast, with tee times booked for 18 holes on 2 days was a bargain so it's worth checking the hotel booking websites. We arrived at the hotel ( taxi fare 30 euros from airport, this included extra for 2 sets of golf clubs on top of our luggage so v reasonable ) 2 hours before check in hoping it would be quiet and would be allowed to check in early, we were horrified to find at least 200 other guests had arrived litterally minutes before us on 4 coaches and the reception lobby was mayhem, luckily they were being directed to one of the many confrence areas and not to the check in desk , checked in early no problems and was given a room on the second floor. It was clear from previous reports and the photos on their website we were in the older of the 2 hotels Sheraton have in this area (there is third hotel nearer Rome centre) but the room was fine, clean and bright, serviced every day and was more than adequate for our needs. Buffett breakfast was ok though would probably not have paid the asking price of, I think, 18 euros if it had not been included in the deal. Didn't have time to try the restaurant so cannot comment on this. We are high handicappers and the course was a joy to play, we did not get the best of the weather but we managed to get round both days, the worst of the weather held off until we got into the centre of Rome late afternoon each day, we had terrible rain and hail storms on both days which did spoil the sightseeing. The shuttle bus is a real must as you are a good distance from the centre, try and avoid coming and going between around 16.00 and 20.00 as the rush 'hour' lasts forever! also, try and avoid the cafe directly at the bus stop, we did expect to pay over the odds in the centre of Rome for drinks but 14 euros for a can of Coke and 2 small local beers seemed a bit of a rip off! I think the paying customers inside were unfairly levied for the many other bus passangers taking shelter under the cafe's umbrellas outside. Would definitely return, maybe wait until spring / summer and hope we can get a good package deal as we did this visit. Arrivederci!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with all amenities”
Reviews.Author: rsawh78298
Reviews.Content: For Rome this is better price value hotel. Hotel rooms are well furnished and spacious with choice of bath tub and shower. Breakfast was super and free. Hotel runs free shuttle service to Piaza Venezeia every 1.5 hour and to Rome Funicino Airport in the morning. Staff is very decent and they all speak English also. Only dislike was that it is about 15 miles from all Roman attractions. With bus shuttle I will still prefer this hotel than pricey so so hotel in Rome Central.

Reviews.Title: “Not for people allergic to perfume”
Reviews.Author: bofoster
Reviews.Content: New additions in a continuous development, intended for business conventions etc but used mostly by group tours due to its proximity to FCO airport. Gorgeous layout as a resort hotel with good amenities. Feeling like 4-5*. Breakfast was nothing special, 3*. Breakfast service layout was clumsy & actually invites trouble; because it involves guests to move around more frequently than necessary. The bathroom layout is still "single" minded, difficult for 2 persons to use at the same time. The curtain rod should have been curved like that at Sheraton Roma at EUR.

Reviews.Title: “Decent; good choice for near airport”
Reviews.Author: thirtyish
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to the airport. I don't usually expect much from airport hotels in many large European cities. It is a huge resort with 2 different buildings and Hotels did not specify which building we were in. So we initially waited behind an angry woman who did not have a room before we found out that our room was in the other building 800 meters down the road. Good thing anyway, since the first builiding, the "clubhouse" building had several trees that housed protected migratory birds and the screeching sounded like a pig being killed. Second building was more peaceful and lobby more attractive. They upgraded us to a junior suite since I think all the standard rooms had been given to the tour groups. Room was nice, however the carpet had some torn up areas and stains. Shower was visually attractive but had a horrible flooding through the shower doors. Separate bath was nice. Nice decor. Breakfast free and good and the hotel coffee was better than most of the big chains, maybe because it was italian coffee. Reception desk at our arrival and departure was very courteous and professional. Only problem was in the morning there is no in room check out and there was only one person at reception and we got behind a business traveller who was checking in with lots of questions and waited more than ten minutes to just turn in our plastic key. Free parking. On the resort is an American style movie megaplex owned by Warner Brothers. We chose not to venture into this "attraction."

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: resorttrip
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, actually 2 hotels .. one was closed in August 2006. We had a large room with view over the golf course. The location is a little remote, near the autostrada. We used the hotel shuttle every day to go to central Rome, a 20 min. ride. Parking was free.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelVA
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults and 15-year old child) recently stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Here is a recap: Positives: - Used starwood points. This was a great deal at only 4,000 points per night. - Requested a "new" room and it was beautiful; large with a nice bathroom; separate shower and tub. King bed and rollaway were very comfortable - Hotel is about 18 miles from the center of Rome; we used the shuttle each day. It was very comfortable, reliable, and drop off/pickup is in a central location at Piazza Venezia. Expect to spend 45 minutes to an hour (depending on traffic) for the commute - Management was responsive and very appologetic for several mishaps (see below) Negatives: - Booked through a starwood customer service representative and was not told that there is an extra charge for rollaway; be careful in Europe (as we found out the hard way) rollaways are typically only free for children 12 and under; older children count as third person. We discussed this with the clerk at check-in and she agreed to waive the charge because of the starwood mix-up. However, we were charged 70 Euros per night (ouch!) for our 15-year old. Fortunately, we noticed this on the video bill early on. After much discussion with clerks, management, and Starwood customer service, the fee was waived. - At reservation requested non-smoking room but got smoking; there was no smell, so no big deal; this mix up was one of the reasons the rollaway charge was waived. - Had problem with shower (water wouldn't drain); took three repeat calls for an improvement (drained better, but never great); this was also one of the reasons the rollaway fee was waived - First shuttle doesn't leave for Rome until 9 (count on getting to Rome by 10). We're early birds, but adjusted without much trouble. - Hotel is far from restaurants, so you're pretty much forced to eat there. The only choice at breakfast is the buffet, 11 Euros each. Good food with good variety between hot and cold foods. However, hot foods were the same every day. By the fourth morning we were tired of bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, and hashbrowns. Two garden salads, water, a glass of wine, and fruit salad at dinner were 43 Euros. Overall it was a great stay and well worth the points; don't know that I'd feel the same way if we paid the extra 70 Euros/night for the rollaway. As an aside, beware - taxi drivers have a scam going. We were charged 60 Euros for a 15 minute ride from the airport. That's about double what we should have paid. Apparently, drivers can choose if they charge you rate 1 or 2. Rate 2 doubles the price. As we found out later, we should have refused to pay it and threatened to call the police.

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Golf Parco de' Medici Hotel & Resort
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Salvatore Rebecchini, 39, 00148 Rome, Italy
